item.description: VLAN VLANs (broadcast domains) provide a way to separate LANs on the same switch. VLANs don’t share broadcasts.

item.title: Attacks

item.title: 3D Secure
item.description: This article is about 3DS protocol (XML-based) which is used to secure online payments. There are three parties in this process: merchant, aquirer and the bank (the issuer of the card).

item.title: Kerberos
item.description: Intro Secure shell. Significant improvement over telnet for remote control (since telnet was not encrypting the connection).

item.description: In this article I’m trying to untangle a very confusing notion for some people (myself included) - App Transport Security.

item.title: ARP
item.description: This article is about ARP protocol. It’s used to map IP addresses to physical (MAC) addresses.

item.title: TCP
